alert.note: Alert for Northern Cook, Northern Lake; Southern Cook, North Shore (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 21 at 10:01AM CST until February 21 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Snow intensity will be light this morning with it ramping up this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Northern Cook and Lake and Southern Cook Counties. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Grand Portage Reservation. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM CST Tuesday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until noon CST today. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The snow will develop later this morning with little accumulation this morning. The snow will diminish again later tonight before increasing in intensity Tuesday morning into the afternoon. Wind chills will again drop to around 30 below tonight. The snow should be dry and fluffy.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.

area.areaDesc: Northern Cook, Northern Lake; Southern Cook, North Shore
